ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is the Day when mankind will be like scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: A Day on which human beings would be like so many scattered moths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: On that Day human beings shall be like scattered moths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: On that day, people will be like scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: The day when men will be like scattered moths.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: The day on which men shall be as scattered moths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: The day that men shall be like scattered moths,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: A day wherein mankind will be as thickly-scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [It is] a Day when mankind shall be like scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: A Day whereon mankind shall become as moths scattered,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [It is] the day when mankind will be like scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: (It is) a Day whereon men will be like moths scattered about,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: It is a Day whereon mankind will be like moths scattered about,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: On that Day people shall become like scattered moths
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: The Day when the people will be like scattered moths.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [101:4] The day (yawma: that which renders it accusative is [the verb] indicated by al-qāri‘a, in other words, [by the implied] taqra‘u, ‘it clatters’) mankind will be like scattered moths, like a throng of scattered locusts surging into each other in confusion, until they are summoned to the Reckoning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: Allah then gave more details about it, saying: (A day wherein mankind will be) a day when people will fall on each other (as thickly scattered moths
